10  package de.funfried.netbeans.plugins.external.formatter;
11  
12  import java.io.IOException;
13  import java.io.StringReader;
14  import java.util.SortedSet;
15  import java.util.TreeSet;
16  import java.util.logging.Level;
17  import java.util.logging.Logger;
18  
19  import javax.swing.text.BadLocationException;
20  import javax.swing.text.StyledDocument;
21  
22  import org.apache.commons.collections4.CollectionUtils;
23  import org.apache.commons.lang3.StringUtils;
24  import org.apache.commons.lang3.mutable.MutableInt;
25  import org.apache.commons.lang3.tuple.Pair;
26  import org.netbeans.api.annotations.common.NonNull;
27  import org.netbeans.api.diff.Difference;
28  import org.netbeans.api.editor.guards.GuardedSection;
29  import org.netbeans.api.editor.guards.GuardedSectionManager;
30  import org.netbeans.lib.editor.util.swing.DocumentUtilities;
31  import org.openide.text.NbDocument;
32  
33  import de.funfried.netbeans.plugins.external.formatter.ui.editor.diff.Diff;
34  
35  /**
36   * Abstract base implementation of a {@link FormatJob} which is called by the
37   * {@link FormatterService} where this implementation belongs to.
38   *
39   * @author bahlef
40   */
41  public abstract class AbstractFormatJob implements FormatJob {
42  	/** {@link Logger} of this class. */
43  	private static final Logger log = Logger.getLogger(AbstractFormatJob.class.getName());
44  
45  	/** Log {@link Level} for fast switching while investigating issues. */
46  	private static final Level logLevel = Level.FINER;
47  
48  	/** {@link SortedSet} containing document offset ranges which should be formatted. */
49  	protected final SortedSet<Pair<Integer, Integer>> changedElements;
50  
51  	/** The {@link StyledDocument} from which the content should be formatted. */
52  	protected final StyledDocument document;
53  
54  	/**
55  	 * Constructor which has to be used by subclasses.
56  	 *
57  	 * @param document the {@link StyledDocument} from which the content should be formatted
58  	 * @param changedElements {@link SortedSet} containing document offset ranges which should be formatted or {@code null} to format the whole document
59  	 */
60  	protected AbstractFormatJob(StyledDocument document, SortedSet<Pair<Integer, Integer>> changedElements) {
61  		this.document = document;
62  		this.changedElements = changedElements;
63  	}
64  
65  	/**
66  	 * Applies the given {@code formattedContent} to the {@code document}.
67  	 *
68  	 * @param code the previous (unformatted) content
69  	 * @param formattedContent the formatted code
70  	 *
71  	 * @return {@code true} if and only if the given {@code formattedContent} was set to
72  	 *         the {@code document}, if due to any circumstances (old code equals formatted code,
73  	 *         thrown exceptions, ...) the {@code formattedContent} wasn't applied {@code false}
74  	 *         is returned
75  	 *
76  	 * @throws BadLocationException if there is an issue while applying the formatted code
77  	 */
78  	protected boolean setFormattedCode(String code, String formattedContent) throws BadLocationException {
79  		// quick check for changed
80  		if (formattedContent != null && /* does not support changes of EOL */ !formattedContent.equals(code)) {
81  			try (StringReader original = new StringReader(code);
82  					StringReader formatted = new StringReader(formattedContent)) {
83  				Difference[] differences = Diff.diff(original, formatted);
84  				if (differences != null && differences.length != 0) {
85  					if (log.isLoggable(logLevel)) {
86  						log.log(logLevel, "Unformatted: ''{0}''", code);
87  						log.log(logLevel, "Formatted: ''{0}''", formattedContent);
88  					}
89  
90  					for (Difference d : differences) {
91  						int startLine = d.getSecondStart();
92  
93  						switch (d.getType()) {
94  							case Difference.ADD: {
95  								int start = NbDocument.findLineOffset(document, startLine - 1);
96  								String addText = d.getSecondText();
97  
98  								if (log.isLoggable(logLevel)) {
99  									log.log(logLevel, "ADD: {0} / Line {1}: {2}", new Object[] { start, startLine, addText });
100 								}
101 
102 								document.insertString(start, addText, null);
103 
104 								break;
105 							}
106 							case Difference.CHANGE: {
107 								int start = NbDocument.findLineOffset(document, startLine - 1);
108 								String removeText = d.getFirstText();
109 								int length = removeText.length();
110 
111 								String addText = d.getSecondText();
112 
113 								if (log.isLoggable(logLevel)) {
114 									log.log(logLevel, "CHANGE: {0} - {1} / Line {2}: ''{3}'' <= ''{4}'' ({5})", new Object[] { start, length, startLine, addText, document.getText(start, length), removeText });
115 								}
116 
117 								// if the document consists of only 1 line without a trailing line-break
118 								// then LENGTH would exceed the document and yield an exception
119 
120 								document.remove(start, Math.min(length, document.getLength()));
121 								document.insertString(start, addText, null);
122 
123 								break;
124 							}
125 							case Difference.DELETE: {
126 								int start = NbDocument.findLineOffset(document, startLine);
127 								String removeText = d.getFirstText();
128 								int length = removeText.length();
129 
130 								if (log.isLoggable(logLevel)) {
131 									log.log(logLevel, "DELETE: {0} - {1} / Line {2}: ''{3}'' ({4})", new Object[] { start, length, startLine, document.getText(start, length), removeText });
132 								}
133 
134 								document.remove(start, length);
135 
136 								break;
137 							}
138 						}
139 					}
140 
141 					return true;
142 				}
143 			} catch (IOException ex) {
144 				log.log(Level.WARNING, "Could not create diff", ex);
145 			}
146 		}
147 
148 		return false;
149 	}
150 
151 	/**
152 	 * Returns the content of the {@code document}.
153 	 *
154 	 * @return The content of the {@code document}
155 	 */
156 	protected String getCode() {
157 		return StringUtils.trim(DocumentUtilities.getText(document).toString());
158 	}
159 
160 	/**
161 	 * Returns a {@link SortedSet} within ranges as {@link Pair}s of {@link Integer}s
162 	 * which describe the start and end offsets that can be formatted, it automatically
163 	 * checks for guarded sections and removes them before returning the {@link SortedSet},
164 	 * this means if an empty {@link SortedSet} was removed nothing can be formatted,
165 	 * because all ranges in the {@code changedElements} are in guarded sections.
166 	 *
167 	 * @param code the current unformatted content of the {@link document}
168 	 *
169 	 * @return A {@link SortedSet} within ranges as {@link Pair}s of {@link Integer}s
170 	 *         which describe the start and end offsets which can be formatted or an empty
171 	 *         {@link SortedSet} if nothing of the {@code changedElements} can be formatted
172 	 */
173 	@NonNull
174 	protected SortedSet<Pair<Integer, Integer>> getFormatableSections(String code) {
175 		SortedSet<Pair<Integer, Integer>> regions = changedElements;
176 		if (CollectionUtils.isEmpty(changedElements)) {
177 			regions = new TreeSet<>();
178 
179 			regions.add(Pair.of(0, code.length() - 1));
180 		}
181 
182 		GuardedSectionManager guards = GuardedSectionManager.getInstance(document);
183 		if (guards != null) {
184 			SortedSet<Pair<Integer, Integer>> nonGuardedSections = new TreeSet<>();
185 			Iterable<GuardedSection> guardedSections = guards.getGuardedSections();
186 
187 			if (log.isLoggable(logLevel)) {
188 				{
189 					StringBuilder sb = new StringBuilder();
190 					regions.stream().forEach(section -> sb.append(section.getLeft()).append("/").append(section.getRight()).append(" "));
191 					log.log(logLevel, "Formatting sections before guards: {0}", sb.toString().trim());
192 				}
193 
194 				{
195 					StringBuilder sb = new StringBuilder();
196 					guardedSections.forEach(guard -> sb.append(guard.getStartPosition().getOffset()).append("/").append(guard.getEndPosition().getOffset()).append(" "));
197 					log.log(logLevel, "Guarded sections: {0}", sb.toString().trim());
198 				}
199 			}
200 
201 			for (Pair<Integer, Integer> changedElement : regions) {
202 				nonGuardedSections.addAll(avoidGuardedSection(changedElement, guardedSections));
203 			}
204 
205 			regions = nonGuardedSections;
206 		}
207 
208 		if (log.isLoggable(logLevel)) {
209 			StringBuilder sb = new StringBuilder();
210 			regions.stream().forEach(section -> sb.append(section.getLeft()).append("/").append(section.getRight()).append(" "));
211 			log.log(logLevel, "Formatting sections: {0}", sb.toString().trim());
212 		}
213 
214 		return regions;
215 	}
216 
217 	/**
218 	 * Checks if a given {@code section} interferes with the given {@code guardedSections}
219 	 * and if so splits the given {@code section} into multiple sections and returns them
220 	 * as a {@link SortedSet}.
221 	 *
222 	 * @param section the section that should be checked
223 	 * @param guardedSections the guarded sections of the {@code document}
224 	 *
225 	 * @return A {@link SortedSet} containing the splitted sections or just the initial
226 	 *         {@code section} itself if there was no interference with the given
227 	 *         {@code guardedSections}
228 	 */
229 	protected SortedSet<Pair<Integer, Integer>> avoidGuardedSection(Pair<Integer, Integer> section, Iterable<GuardedSection> guardedSections) {
230 		SortedSet<Pair<Integer, Integer>> ret = new TreeSet<>();
231 
232 		MutableInt start = new MutableInt(section.getLeft());
233 		MutableInt end = new MutableInt(section.getRight());
234 
235 		if (guardedSections != null) {
236 			try {
237 				guardedSections.forEach(guardedSection -> {
238 					if (start.getValue() >= guardedSection.getStartPosition().getOffset() && start.getValue() <= guardedSection.getEndPosition().getOffset()) {
239 						if (end.getValue() > guardedSection.getEndPosition().getOffset()) {
240 							start.setValue(guardedSection.getEndPosition().getOffset());
241 						} else {
242 							start.setValue(-1);
243 							end.setValue(-1);
244 
245 							throw new BreakException();
246 						}
247 					} else if (end.getValue() >= guardedSection.getStartPosition().getOffset() && end.getValue() <= guardedSection.getEndPosition().getOffset()) {
248 						if (start.getValue() < guardedSection.getStartPosition().getOffset()) {
249 							end.setValue(guardedSection.getStartPosition().getOffset() - 1);
250 						} else {
251 							start.setValue(-1);
252 							end.setValue(-1);
253 
254 							throw new BreakException();
255 						}
256 					} else if (start.getValue() < guardedSection.getStartPosition().getOffset() && end.getValue() > guardedSection.getEndPosition().getOffset()) {
257 						ret.add(Pair.of(start.getValue(), guardedSection.getStartPosition().getOffset() - 1));
258 
259 						start.setValue(guardedSection.getEndPosition().getOffset());
260 					}
261 				});
262 			} catch (BreakException ex) {
263 				// found no better solution to break a forEach
264 			}
265 		}
266 
267 		if (start.getValue() > -1 && end.getValue() > -1) {
268 			ret.add(Pair.of(start.getValue(), end.getValue()));
269 		}
270 
271 		return ret;
272 	}
273 
274 	/**
275 	 * {@link RuntimeException} which is used as a {@code break} condition inside
276 	 * a {@link Iterable#forEach(java.util.function.Consumer)}.
277 	 */
278 	protected static class BreakException extends RuntimeException {
279 		private static final long serialVersionUID = 1L;
280 	}
281 }
